classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.entities.IScriptPlayer

methods.name: getInventory
getEquipment
getQuests
canControl
methods.doc: Check whether this player can be controlled.

methods.name: setControl
methods.doc: Toggle player's controls.

arguments.name: canControl
arguments.doc: True is can control, false is lock the controls.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.entities.IScriptEntity

methods.name: getRawEntity
methods.doc: Get raw entity instance.

methods.name: getPosition
setPosition
getVelocity
setVelocity
getRotations
setRotations
getLook
getWidth
methods.doc: Get entity's current hitbox width (and depth, it's the same number).

methods.name: getHeight
methods.doc: Get entity's current hitbox height.

methods.name: isSneaking
rayTrace
methods.doc:
Ray trace from entity's looking direction (including any entity intersection).
 Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

methods.name: rayTraceBlock
methods.doc:
Ray trace from entity's looking direction (excluding entities).
 Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

methods.name: getMainItem
setMainItem
getOffItem
setOffItem
getUniqueId
methods.doc:
Get unique ID of this entity, which can be used, if needed, in
 commands as a target selector.

methods.name: getEntityId
methods.doc: Get entity's ID.

methods.name: getTicks
methods.doc: Get how many ticks did this entity existed.

methods.name: getName
methods.doc: Get entity name.

methods.name: getFullData
methods.doc: Get entity's full (copy of its) data.

methods.name: setFullData
methods.doc: Overwrite data of this entity. WARNING: use it only if you know what are you doing as this method can corrupt entities.

methods.name: isPlayer
methods.doc: Check whether this entity is a player.

methods.name: isNpc
methods.doc: Check whether this entity is an NPC.

methods.name: isSame
methods.doc: Check whether this entity is same as given entity.

methods.name: remove
methods.doc: Remove this entity from the server without any dead effects (essentially despawn).

methods.name: kill
methods.doc: Kill this entity from the server by inflicting lots of damage.

methods.name: getStates
methods.doc: Get entity's states (if it has some, only players and NPCs have states).

returns.doc: entity's states, or null if this entity doesn't have states.

methods.name: getForm
methods.doc:
Returns this entity's form (if it's present). It's not a copy, but
 a direct reference.

methods.name: setForm

returns.doc: if entity's form was changed successfully.

methods.name: getFirstPersonForm
methods.doc:
Returns this entity's first-person form (if it's present). It's not a copy,
 but a direct reference.

methods.name: setFirstPersonForm

returns.doc: if entity's first person form was changed successfully.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.global.IScriptUI
classes.doc:
Script UI API.

You can access it in the script as bbs.ui or bbs.getUi().

methods.name: createFromData
methods.doc: Create a UI from user created UI in the UI dashboard panel (with no script handler).

methods.name: createFromData
createFromData
methods.doc:
Create a UI from user created UI in the UI dashboard panel with attached
 handler script to it (and a function).

methods.name: create
create

arguments.name: event
arguments.doc: Script event (whose script ID will be used for UI's user input handler).

arguments.name: function
arguments.doc: Given script's function that will be used as UI's user input handler.

methods.name: create

arguments.name: script
arguments.doc: The script which will be used as UI's user input handler.

arguments.name: function
arguments.doc: Given script's function that will be used as UI's user input handler.

methods.name: open
open
close
methods.doc: Close currently opened user interface.

methods.name: getUIContext
methods.doc:
Get the UI context of currently opened user UI. See {@link IScriptUIContext}
 for code examples.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.global.IScriptItems
classes.doc:
Script item API.

You can access it in the script as bbs.items or bbs.getItems().

methods.name: create

returns.doc:
an item stack from the data, or an empty item stack if the
         data doesn't have a valid reference to an existing item

methods.name: create

returns.doc:
an item stack with an item specified by ID, or an empty item
         stack if the block doesn't exist

methods.name: create

returns.doc:
an item stack with an item specified by ID, or an empty item
         stack if the block doesn't exist

methods.name: createData

returns.doc:
an item stack from the string data, or an empty item stack
         if the data doesn't have a valid reference to an existing item

Script HUD stages API.

You can access it in the script as bbs.hud or bbs.getHud().

methods.name: changeForm

arguments.doc: HUD scene's ID/filename.

arguments.name: index
arguments.doc: Index of the form in the scene that should be changed (0 is the first, and so on).

methods.name: changeForm

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: HUD scene's ID/filename.

arguments.name: index
arguments.doc: Index of the form in the scene that should be changed (0 is the first, and so on).

arguments.name: form
arguments.doc: Data of the form.

methods.name: closeAll
close

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: HUD scene's ID/filename.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.global.IScriptClient
classes.doc:
Script client.

You can access it in the script as bbs.client or bbs.getClient().

methods.name: reload
reload
methods.doc:
Reload specific client's component or all of them. Available arguments:

  • textures - reload texture manager.
  • language - reload language strings.
  • models - reload loaded models.
{@code
    bbs.client.reload("textures");
 }

methods.name: setWindowSize
playVideo
methods.doc: Start a video playback.

returns.doc: Whether video was successfully started to play.

arguments.name: path
arguments.doc: Path to resource within asset provider system like assets:videos/funny_cat.mp4

methods.name: stopVideo
methods.doc: Stop video playback.

arguments.name: path
arguments.doc: Path to the resource that was already loaded by playVideo method.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.global.IScriptCamera
classes.doc:
Script camera.

You can access it in the script as bbs.camera or bbs.getCamera().

methods.name: play
play
isPlaying
methods.doc: Checks whether a camera profile is currently playing.

methods.name: stop
lock
methods.doc:
Lock the camera. This allows to control the camera with other methods in this camera API. The player still can control their character. The default camera position (if not changed with other methods) is whatever was camera's position at the moment of locking. 
{@code
    bbs.camera.lock();
 }

methods.name: isLocked
methods.doc: Check whether camera is currently locked.

methods.name: set
unlock

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.global.IScriptAnimations
classes.doc:
Script animations.

You can access it in the script as bbs.animations or bbs.getAnimations().

methods.name: play
isPlaying
methods.doc: Check whether given animation is playing.

methods.name: stop

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.IScriptWorld

methods.name: getRawWorld
methods.doc: Get raw world instance.

methods.name: setBlock
getBlock

returns.doc: a block state at given XYZ, or null if the chunk isn't loaded

methods.name: placeStructure
methods.doc:
Place a structure in the world at given coordinates. See the same method
 with anchor for more information.

methods.name: placeStructure

returns.doc: whether the structure was placed in the world.

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: Structure filename (in game/config/structures/) without extension.

arguments.name: x
arguments.doc: X coordinate of the point to place the structure at.

arguments.name: y
arguments.doc: Y coordinate of the point to place the structure at.

arguments.name: z
arguments.doc: Z coordinate of the point to place the structure at.

arguments.name: ax
arguments.doc: Anchor (X coordinate) that will offset the origin point where structure will be placed.

arguments.name: ay
arguments.doc: Anchor (Y coordinate) that will offset the origin point where structure will be placed.

arguments.name: az
arguments.doc: Anchor (Z coordinate) that will offset the origin point where structure will be placed.

methods.name: rayTrace
methods.doc:
Ray trace from given point in given direction.

Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

methods.name: rayTraceBlock
methods.doc:
Ray trace from entity's looking direction (excluding entities).

Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

methods.name: getObject
methods.doc: Get a world object by given ID.

returns.doc: First world object found by given ID.

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: ID of the object.

methods.name: getObjects
methods.doc: Get world objects by given ID.

returns.doc: All world object found by given ID.

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: ID of the object.

methods.name: getAllObjects
methods.doc: Get all world objects.

methods.name: spawnEntity
spawnEntity
dropItem
getEntities
getEntities
getEntityByUUID
methods.doc: Get an entity in the world by its UUID.

methods.name: getAllEntities
playSound
playSound
getStates
methods.doc: Get world's states.

methods.name: displayForm
methods.doc: Display a world form in the world at given point.

methods.name: displayForm

arguments.name: form
arguments.doc: Form that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).

arguments.name: expiration
arguments.doc: For how many ticks will this displayed form exist on the client side.

arguments.name: yaw
arguments.doc: Horizontal rotation in degrees.

arguments.name: pitch
arguments.doc: Vertical rotation in degrees.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.IScriptRayTrace

methods.name: getRawRayTraceResult
methods.doc: Get raw ray trace result.

methods.name: isMissed
methods.doc: Check whether this ray trace result didn't capture anything.

methods.name: isBlock
methods.doc: Check whether this ray trace result hit a block.

methods.name: isEntity
methods.doc: Check whether this ray trace result hit an entity.

methods.name: getEntity
methods.doc: Get entity that was captured by this ray trace result (it can be null).

methods.name: getBlock
methods.doc: Get block position it hit.

methods.name: getHitPosition
methods.doc: Get precise position where it hit.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.IScriptEvent
classes.doc:
Script event.

This interface represent the event, the only argument that was passed into script's function. It contains many different useful methods to interact with the game engine.

methods.name: getScript
methods.doc: Get script's ID to which this event was passed to.

methods.name: getFunction
methods.doc: Get script's function name.

methods.name: getSubject
methods.doc: Get subject (primary) entity that was passed into the event.

methods.name: getObject
methods.doc: Get object (secondary) entity that was passed into the event.

methods.name: getPlayer
methods.doc: Get the first player from either subject or object (or null, if there is no player).

methods.name: getValues
methods.doc: Get a map of extra context values that was passed into the event.

methods.name: getValue
methods.doc: Get a value for given key (might be a null).

methods.name: setValue
methods.doc: Set a value for given key in extra data.

methods.name: cancel
methods.doc: Cancel the trigger event.

methods.name: scheduleScript

arguments.name: delay
arguments.doc: How many ticks should pass before scheduled script will be executed.

methods.name: scheduleScript
scheduleScript
scheduleScript

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.IScriptBlockVariant
classes.doc: Script representation of a block variant.

methods.name: getBlockVariant
methods.doc: Get raw instance of this block variant.

methods.name: getBlockId
methods.doc: Get block ID of this block variant.

methods.name: getVariant
methods.doc: Get integer (index) of the block variant.

methods.name: isAir
methods.doc: Check if this block variant is an air block.

methods.name: isSame
methods.doc: Check if the given block variant is same as this.

BBS scripting API which offers sub APIs.

You can access it in the script as bbs global variable.

methods.name: getCamera

methods.name: getHud
methods.doc: Get HUD scenes sub API.

methods.name: getWorlds

methods.name: isDevelopment
methods.doc: Check whether the user is currently in development mode.

methods.name: get
set
send
dump
dump

arguments.name: simple

Whether you want to see simple or full information about
               the object.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.ui.IScriptUIContext

methods.name: getData
isClosed
getLast
getHotkey
methods.doc:
Get the ID of the last pressed hot key.

If no keybind was pressed, it will be an empty string (""). See {@link UIComponent#keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean)} method for an example.

methods.name: getContext
methods.doc:
Get the ID of the last context menu item.

If no context menu was activated, it will be an empty string (""). See {@link UIComponent#context(String, String, String, int)} method for an example.

methods.name: get
sendToPlayer

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.ui.IScriptUIBuilder

methods.name: get
methods.doc: Get a UI component by given ID.

methods.name: getCurrent
methods.doc:
Get current UI component on to which it adds children components.

It's useful only after using {@link IScriptUIBuilder#layout()}, {@link IScriptUIBuilder#column(int)}, {@link IScriptUIBuilder#row(int)}, and {@link IScriptUIBuilder#grid(int)} to being able to position layout element.

methods.name: background
methods.doc: Enable default background (subtle gradient of two half transparent dark colors).

methods.name: notClosable
closable
methods.doc: Toggle closability of this UI screen.

arguments.name: closable
arguments.doc: Whether this UI screen can be closed or not (by default it is closable).

methods.name: create

arguments.name: id
arguments.doc: ID of desired component to be created.

methods.name: graphics
methods.doc:
Create and insert a graphics UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIGraphicsComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: button
methods.doc:
Create and insert a button UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIButtonComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: icon
methods.doc:
Create and insert an icon button UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIIconButtonComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: label
methods.doc:
Create and insert a label UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILabelComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: text
methods.doc:
Create and insert a text UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILabelComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: textbox
methods.doc:
Create and insert a textbox UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITextboxComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: textbox
methods.doc:
Create and insert a textbox UI component into UI, with default value filled, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITextboxComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: textbox
methods.doc:
Create and insert a textbox UI component into UI, with default value filled and maximum length, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITextboxComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: textarea
methods.doc:
Create and insert a textarea UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITextareaComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: textarea
methods.doc:
Create and insert a textarea UI component into UI, with default value filled, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITextareaComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: toggle
methods.doc:
Create and insert a toggle UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIToggleComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: toggle
methods.doc:
Create and insert a toggle UI component into UI, with default toggled state, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIToggleComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: trackpad
methods.doc:
Create and insert a trackpad UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITrackpadComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: trackpad
methods.doc:
Create and insert a trackpad UI component into UI, with default filled value, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UITrackpadComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: stringList
methods.doc:
Create and insert a string list UI component into UI, with list of possible values in the list, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIStringListComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: stringList
methods.doc:
Create and insert a string list UI component into UI, with list of possible values in the list and selected index by default, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIStringListComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: item
methods.doc:
Create and insert an item stack UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UISlotComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: item
methods.doc:
Create and insert an item stack UI component into UI, with default item stack picked, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UISlotComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: form
methods.doc:
Create and insert a form UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIFormComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: form
methods.doc:
Create and insert a form UI component into UI, with a flag whether the player can pick or edit the form, being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIFormComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: click
methods.doc:
Create and insert a click area UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UIClickComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: layout
methods.doc:
Create and insert a layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: column
methods.doc:
Create and insert a column layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: column
methods.doc:
Create and insert a column layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: row
methods.doc:
Create and insert a row layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: row
methods.doc:
Create and insert a row layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: grid
methods.doc:
Create and insert a grid layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

methods.name: grid
methods.doc:
Create and insert a grid layout UI component into UI being built by this builder.

Check {@link UILayoutComponent} for description and examples.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.components.UITrackpadComponent

methods.name: value
methods.doc: Set the value that of trackpad component.

methods.name: min
methods.doc: Set the minimum that this trackpad component can let the user pick.

methods.name: max
methods.doc: Set the maximum that this trackpad component can let the user pick.

methods.name: integer
methods.doc: Set this trackpad component to accept only whole numbers.

methods.name: integer
methods.doc: Toggle integer option, when passed true then this trackpad component will accept only whole numbers, and when passed false, then both whole and floating point numbers can be accepted by this trackpad.

methods.name: limit
methods.doc:
Convenience method that allows to set minimum and maximum, i.e. value range,
 that this trackpad field can accept.

methods.name: limit
methods.doc:
Convenience method that allows to set minimum, maximum, and integer options
 that this trackpad field can accept.

methods.name: amplitudes
methods.doc: Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when moving the cursor horizontally. Weak (Alt amplitude gets set 5 times weaker than input value, and strong (Shift) amplitude gets set 5 times stronger than input value.

methods.name: amplitudes
methods.doc:
Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when
 moving the cursor horizontally.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.doc: Value change per pixel when no modifiers is held.

arguments.name: weak
arguments.doc: Value change per pixel when alt is held.

arguments.name: strong
arguments.doc: Value change per pixel when shift is held.

methods.name: increment
methods.doc:
Changes the incremental value of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much being added
 or subtracted when user presses < and > buttons on the sides of the
 trackpad value.

arguments.name: increment
arguments.doc: Value change per click on increment buttons.

selected

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.components.UILayoutComponent

methods.name: scroll
scrollSize
horizontal
methods.doc:
Enables horizontal mode. This usable when {@link UILayoutComponent#scroll()}
 is enabled.

methods.name: width
methods.doc:
Per component width (in pixels) that should be sustained within
 {@link IScriptUIBuilder#grid(int)} layout type. This doesn't work with any other
 component than grid.

methods.name: items
methods.doc:
How many components per row that should be placed within
 {@link IScriptUIBuilder#grid(int)} layout type. This option doesn't work with
 any other component than grid.

methods.name: background

labelAnchor
color
color
label
noBackground

methods.name: icon

arguments.doc: The icon's ID.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.components.UIGraphicsComponent

methods.name: removeAll
methods.doc: Remove all graphics (think of it like wiping a chalkboard).

methods.name: rect
methods.doc: Draw a solid colored rectangle.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills the rectangle.

methods.name: rect
methods.doc: Draw a solid colored rectangle relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: w
arguments.doc: Width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: h
arguments.doc: Height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills the rectangle.

methods.name: gradient
methods.doc: Draw a vertical gradient rectangle.

arguments.name: primary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills top part of the gradient.

arguments.name: secondary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills bottom part of the gradient.

methods.name: gradient
methods.doc: Draw a vertical/horizontal gradient rectangle.

arguments.name: primary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills top part of the gradient.

arguments.name: secondary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills bottom part of the gradient.

arguments.name: horizontal
arguments.doc: Whether gradient is horizontal (true) or vertical (false).

methods.name: gradient
methods.doc: Draw a vertical gradient rectangle relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: w
arguments.doc: Width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: h
arguments.doc: Height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: primary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills top part of the gradient.

arguments.name: secondary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills bottom part of the gradient.

methods.name: gradient
methods.doc: Draw a gradient rectangle relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: w
arguments.doc: Width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: h
arguments.doc: Height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: primary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills top or left part of the gradient.

arguments.name: secondary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills bottom or right part of the gradient.

arguments.name: horizontal
arguments.doc: Whether gradient is horizontal (true) or vertical (false).

methods.name: image
methods.doc: Draw an image.

methods.name: image
methods.doc: Draw an image.

methods.name: image
methods.doc:
Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame.

Image argument is a so called "resource location." For example, if you want to draw pig's skin on the screen you can input "assets@textures/pixel.png" and it will draw it on the screen.

methods.name: image
methods.doc: Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame with known texture size.

methods.name: image
methods.doc: Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame with known texture size and color.

methods.name: text
methods.doc: Draw a text label relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB text's font color.

methods.name: text
methods.doc: Draw a text label with an anchor relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB text's font color.

arguments.name: anchorX
arguments.doc: Horizontal anchor (0..1).

arguments.name: anchorY
arguments.doc: Vertical anchor (0..1).

methods.name: text
methods.doc: Draw a text label with an anchor relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB text's font color.

arguments.name: anchorX
arguments.doc: Horizontal anchor (0..1).

arguments.name: anchorY
arguments.doc: Vertical anchor (0..1).

methods.name: icon
methods.doc:
Draw a McLib icon relative to graphics component's frame.

Most of the icons are 16x16 so keep that in mind.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB color that used to render an icon.

methods.name: icon
methods.doc: Draw a McLib icon with an anchor relative to graphics component's frame.

arguments.name: color
arguments.doc: ARGB color that used to render an icon.

arguments.name: anchorX
arguments.doc: Horizontal anchor (0..1).

arguments.name: anchorY
arguments.doc: Vertical anchor (0..1).

methods.name: shadow
methods.doc: Draw a drop shadow.

arguments.name: primary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills inside.

arguments.name: secondary
arguments.doc: ARGB color that fills outside.

arguments.name: offset

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.components.UIComponent
classes.doc:
Base UI component.

Every UI component in UI API is based off this base component, and therefore they have all of the methods available for changing ID, margins, frame (x, y, width, and height), tooltip, visibility, enabled, keybinds and update delay.

methods.name: id
methods.doc:
Set the ID of the component.

Without ID, the data that can be inputted by players won't be sent into the script handler, so it is required to set component's ID if you want to receive the data from the component.

BEWARE: multiple components must not share same ID, if they will it will certainly cause bugs in the data that you'll be receiving from the client and the way you retrieve components using {@link IScriptUIContext#get(String)}.

methods.name: tooltip
methods.doc: Set a tooltip that will be displayed at the bottom of component's frame.

methods.name: tooltip

arguments.name: direction
arguments.doc: 0 is bottom. 1 is top. 2 is right. 3 is left.

methods.name: visible

methods.name: keybind
methods.doc:

 See {@link #keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean)} for proper example.

methods.name: keybind

Add a keybind with optional Control and/or Shift modifier(s).
 See {@link #keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean)} for proper example.

classes.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.graphics.Graphic
classes.doc:
Graphic element.

This is a base interface for all graphic elements that are being constructed by {@link UIGraphicsComponent}. Besides storing extra information per a type of graphic, every graphic has position and relative measurements (just like {@link UIComponent} has).

methods.name: x
methods.doc: Set X in pixels relative to parent component.

methods.name: rx

packages.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user
mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.ui
packages.doc:
Welcome to BBS' in-game scripting documentation!

Scripts are JavaScript (ES 5.1) programs that allow you to program game logic.

Scripts are stored in game engine's data/scripts/ folder. The filename without extension of the script is its ID. Depending on the configuration of the script, there might be an additional JSON file with extra non-code data.

Here are global variable(s) that are provided by BBS:

  • bbs, it's a {@link mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.user.IScriptBBS}. It allows you to create and query different data structures.

There are currently two packages available in BBS:

  • Scripting API section covers functions that allow you to interact with game engine's mechanics to some extent.
  • UI API section covers functions that allow you to create custom user intrfaces (UI) which can be used for plethora of things.

Big thanks to TorayLife for scripting API suggestions.

packages.name: mchorse.bbs.game.scripts.ui.components
